description.narrative:
Diakonia, en av Sidas ramorganisationer, har till Sida inkommit med en ansökan om att Sida, tillsammans med fem givare, bidrar till insatsen " Common Gender Fund and its Strategic Plan 2019-2023" i Burkina Faso 2019-2023. Insatsen syftar till att bidra att stärka kvinnors och flickors sociala, ekonomiska, politiska rättigheter genom diverse åtgärder för att på så sätt minska ojämställdhet mellan könen på nationell nivå. Sida har tidigare bidragit med stöd till Common Gender Fund under perioden 2012-2014 och 2016-2018.
Diakonia kommer att genomföra stödet tillsammans med lokala icke-statliga organisationer och myndigheter. Insatsens totala budget är 89 miljoner kronor, varav Sida bidrar med 15 miljoner kronor. Övriga givare (Danmark, Schweiz, UNFPA, UNICEF) kommer att bidra med cirka 27 miljoner kronor. Cirka 73 procent av budgeten kommer att vidareförmedlas till tredje part.

Diakonia, one of Sida's framework organizations, has submitted an application to Sida to jointly finance the intervention "the Common Gender Fund and its Strategic Plan 2019-2023” together with four other donors during the period 2019-2023. The intervention aims to contribute to the implementation of relevant and effective actions to strengthen women's and girls' social, economic, political rights through actions to promote the abandonment of GBV, promotion of economic and political empowerment, strengthening gender mainstreaming, involvement of women and youth in the management of security issues, in order to to reduce gender inequalities at the national level. Sida has previously contributed to the Common Gender Fund in 2012-2014 and 2016-2018.
Diakonia will implement the intervention together with local CSOs and Government authorities. The total budget is 89 Million SEK out of which Sida will contribute with 15 million SEK. Other donors (Denmark, Switzerland, UNFPA, UNICEF) will contribute with approximately 27 million SEK. Approximately 73 % of the intervention budget will be forwarded from Diakonia to third parties.

tag.narrative: 5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

5.4 - Erkänna och värdesätta obetalt omsorgs- och hushållsarbete genom att tillhandahålla offentliga tjänster, infrastruktur och socialt skydd samt genom att främja delat ansvar inom hushållet och familjen, i enlighet med vad som är nationellt lämpligt.

5.4 - Recognize and value unpaid care and domestic work through the provision of public services, infrastructure and social protection policies and the promotion of shared responsibility within the household and the family as nationally appropriate.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

5.a - Genomföra reformer för att ge kvinnor lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till finansiella tjänster, arv och naturresurser, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning

5.a - Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control over land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and natural resources, in accordance with national laws.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

description.narrative: The activities carried out by 12 implementing partners made possible to achieve the 2020 following results based on the 5 axis of the 2019-2023 Strategic Plan: Axis 1: Strengthening actions to promote the abandonment of gender based violence (GBV) The results of this axis were achieved thanks to the activities carried out by 5 implementing partners: - Association for the Promotion and Development of Gulmu (APDG) for the implementation of the "Project to promote women's rights and reduce gender-based violence in the Eastern region" - Catholic Organization for Development and Solidarity (OCADES) Banfora for the implementation of the "Project to strengthen actions to reduce GBV in the rural commune of Soubakaniédougou" - Catholic Organization for Development and Solidarity (OCADES) Nouna for the implementation of the "Project to strengthen the role and status of women and young people within local communities in the provinces of Kossi and Banwa" - Permanent Secretariat of the National Council for the Fight against the Practice of Excision (SP-CNLPE) for the implementation of the "Project to strengthen actions to promote the elimination of the practice of excision in eight (08) regions of Burkina Faso" - National Federation of Wend Yam Groups (FNGWY) for the implementation of the project “STOP Gender-Based Violence in Internally Displaced Persons Sites” Theses results have been achieved: 466 people (79 women) have a better understanding of GBV Gender-based violence (physical, sexual, psychological, economic violence) and are committed to being intermediaries to reduce GBV as much as possible.14 651 people including 8 997 women (61.4%) changed the behavior regarding FGM (Female Genital Mutilation) and 132 heads of families benefiting from family dialogues signed commitments for the abandonment of FGM. 2 funds (mutual legal assistance fund and emergency care fund) have been set up to support victims of GBV. Emergency kits for repairing the after-effects of excision for 200 girls/women were handed over to health centers. 17 cases of female circumcision in 15 provinces were denounced, 7 cases tried, 2 preventive denunciations, 3 cases where investigations were unsuccessful and 3 cases under investigation 75 people (32 men and 43 women) from the Technical Services, namely Social Action, Police, Gendarmerie and Justice, were trained on GBV among internally displaced persons, commit to denounce all forms of gender-based violence. 45 customary chiefs come together to reduce the length of chores inflicted on step-sons and review the value of the dowry Practices that value women in rural areas are promoted: The actions of the husbands of the 12 model couples to unload their wives (bringing water from the fountain, carrying wood from the fields) led to the beginnings of change in the villages. 50% of GBV in households selected for the family dialogue approach and 25% in the project intervention area are reduced: 10 monitoring committees, 10 community watch committees and 10 Souambouli school clubs have been set up. Several leaders and authorities (mayors, prefects, heads of establishments, decentralized technical services, civil society organizations, press, etc.) are involved in the fight against GBV in their respective localities 130 community actors and 800 students are involved in raising awareness about the VEFF law (violence against women and girls) and GBV. Axis 2: Economic and political empowerment of women and young people The results of the axis 2 were achieved thanks to the activities carried out by 2 implementing partners: - African Union of Development NGOs (UAOD) for the implementation of the project "Support for strengthening the citizenship of women and young people" - Burkina Business Incubator (BBI) for START UP Incubation Project. Theses results have been achieved: The technical skills of the eighteen (18) Startups were strengthened in leadership, financial and commercial management, fund raising. 1400 women were made aware of the challenges of voting. A toll-free number for denunciations of cases of gender-based violence in connection with the elections has been opened. 76 cases of violence (psychological, physical, sexual) were recorded on the toll-free number. 40 men and 1,760 women animated the citizens' chamber which made it possible to monitor and supervise the elections from a gender perspective and reduce gender-based violence. A network of 300 observers were deployed in the field for the 2020 elections. A study on the level of involvement of women and women's civil society organizations in strengthening the electoral process in Burkina Faso from 2009 to 2020 was conducted. Axis 3: Strengthening gender mainstreaming in the development and monitoring of public policies, projects and programs by institutions and CSOs Activities carried out by 3 implementing partners allowed to achieve the results of this axis: - Center for Information, Training and Studies on the Budget (CIFOEB) for the implementation of the "Gender Champions Project" - Higher Authority for State Control and the Fight against Corruption (ASCE-LC) for the implementation of "Gender activities of the Enlarged Action Plan (PAE) for institutional and organizational strengthening of the ASCE-LC" - Permanent Secretariat of the National Council for the Promotion of Gender (SP-CONAPGenre) for the implementation of the "Support Project for the Institutionalization of Gender in Public Policies, Development Projects and Programs" Results achieved: 25 gender champions have been identified (17 women). A gender index is available for all local actors (CSOs, local authorities and decentralized technical services) Gender interventions are better coordinated because statistics are available through the National Gender Booklet, the statistical yearbook and the woman and gender dashboard, and the National Gender Strategy and its Operational Action Plan are available. Axis 4: Involvement of women and youth in the management of security issues The results of the axis 4 were achieved trought activities carried out by 2 implementing partners: - Center for Democratic Governance (CGD) for the implementation of the "Project to strengthen the participation of women and girls in the promotion of peace, security and their resilience in the face of Covid-19" - Association Burkina Camp de l'Espoir (ABCE) for the implementation of the "Project to strengthen the resilience of women and young people in the face of the rise of terrorism and violent extremism in the Province of Kossi" Results achieved: A synergy of actions, an inter generational dialogue of women on issues of security and the advancement of women is possible because mixed women's clubs (180 women and young girls) are awareness-raising relays for the promotion of peace and security. Endogenous dialogue and peace promotion mechanisms to prevent and manage terrorism and violent extremism exist: municipal security consultation frameworks (219 men and 33 women), home visits (4 200 people 2715 women affected), an open day for the security and defense services is organised (29 men and 23 women). 5 Regions each have a gender citizen platform Axis 5: Coordination, monitoring, evaluation, capitalization of achievements and promotion of innovative approaches This axis is implemented by Diakonia the Manager of the Fund and concern actions for coordinating.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
